title: Preparation of cobalt catalysts promoted with cerium and barium for low-pressure ammonia synthesis Preparatyka katalizatorów kobaltowych promowanych cerem i barem do niskociśnieniowej syntezy amoniaku

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
<jats:p>A thermal decomposition of a cobalt-lanthanum catalyst precursor containing a mixture of cobalt and lanthanum compounds obtained by co-precipitation were studied using thermal analysis coupled with mass spectrometry (TG-MS). Studies revealed that the calcination in air at 500°C is sufficient to transform the obtained cobalt precipitate into Co<jats:sub>3</jats:sub>O<jats:sub>4</jats:sub>, but it leads to only partial decomposition of lanthanum precipitate. In order to obtain Co/La catalyst precursor containing La<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O<jats:sub>3</jats:sub> the calcination in air at the temperature about 800°C is required. However, it is unfavorable from the point of view of textural properties of the catalyst precursor. A strong effect of storage conditions on the phase composition of the studied cobalt-lanthanum catalyst precursor, caused by the formation of lanthanum hydroxide and lanthanum carbonates from La<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>O<jats:sub>3</jats:sub> when contacting with air, was observed.</jats:p>
title: Cobalt-lanthanum catalyst precursors for ammonia synthesis: determination of calcination temperature and storage conditions
